long_desc.thetext:
Hi, this is my first bug report, so I hope I'll respect all the rules :-)
There is a lack of documentation on event parameter. The doc state whether it is a Data or Event, but one can't find what data ...
Example : http://demo.qooxdoo.org/current/apiviewer/#qx.ui.window.Window~changeActive
Say you want to use it, you'll add alistener : win.addListener("changeActive", function(e) { blabla });
In the blabla, you won't be able, reading the doc, to know something about parameter e.

qx.ui.treevirtual.* now properly documents the data in Data events they generate.
qx.ui.progressive.* has been confirmed to already have properly documented its fired Data events.
qx.util.fsm.* has been confirmed not to fire any Data events.

This seems to be about checking, completing, cross-linking of JSDocs for events rather than typical website documentation.
@Daniel, please have a look. Is this purely manual work, or can this reasonably be automated??

Data events that are fired on property changes (using the changePropertyName naming convention) contain the new value of that property. In the API doc, these events link to the corresponding property definition. Apart from that, there were only a handful of framework classes with undocumented data events. I've added documentation to the following classes:
qx.dev.unit.TestResult qx.ui.control.DateChooser qx.ui.core.Widget qx.ui.form.ComboBox qx.ui.form.RadioGroup qx.ui.form.TextField qx.ui.tabview.TabButton
Closed all bugs already shipped with a release.
